title: Slope-Intercept Form
text:
Write the first equation in slope-intercept form:
$$5x+3y=4$$
$$3y=-5x+4$$
$$ rac{3y}{3}= rac{\left(-5x+4ight)}{3}$$
$$y= rac{-5}{3} x+ rac{4}{3}$$
speech:
Write the first equation in slope-intercept form:
 5 x plus 3 y is equal to, 4 
 3 y, is equal to negative 5 x, plus 4 
, fraction, 3 y, over 3,  is equal to fraction, parentheses, negative 5 x, plus 4, , over 3,  
 y is equal to fraction, negative 5, over 3,  x plus 4 thirds

3 y, is equal to negative 5 x, plus 4
, fraction, 3 y, over 3,  is equal to fraction, , negative 5 x, plus 4, , over 3,
y is equal to fraction, negative 5, over 3,  x plus 4 thirds

title: Slope-Intercept Form
text:
Write the second equation in slope-intercept form:
$$2x-3y=5$$
$$-3y=-2x+5$$
$$ rac{-3y}{-3}= rac{\left(-2x+5ight)}{-3}$$
$$y= rac{2}{3} x- rac{5}{3}$$
speech:
Write the second equation in slope-intercept form:
 2 x minus 3 y is equal to, 5 
 negative 3 y is equal to negative 2 x, plus 5 
 fraction, negative 3 y, over, negative 3,  is equal to fraction, parentheses, negative 2 x, plus 5, , over, negative 3,  
 y is equal to, 2 thirds x minus 5 thirds

title: Intersecting Lines
text: Since the slopes are different, the lines intersect.
